data.title: Benders
data.text: Old school charm, roaring '20's/gangster vibe. It's been said that Al Capone himself has been in that restaurant before. Menu is very diverse, food is excellent. It is pretty expensive, but the food and atmosphere is worth it.

data.title: The glory is gone!
data.text:
I have enjoyed Benders for 20 years. But two recent experiences were consistently bad, indicating that the magic is gone. On both occasions, my food was overcooked and plated with zero regard to presentation. And my recent visit, a Tuesday evening with very light traffic, we received terrible service.
A ten-minute wait for a beverage order was followed by a 10-minute wait for drinks, followed by a 30-minute wait for our food. The food was just dropped on the plates without any regard to appearance. The ends were not even trimmed off of the green beans. The gluten-free broccoli was slathered with bread crumbs and cheese, obviously not gluten free. The 'Bender Fries' were a hard wafter of burned potatoes that were almost impossible to cut. The broccoli was sent back to the kitchen and we never saw our waiter again and 40 minutes later, had to shoot off fireworks to get our bill.

data.title: Excellent old atmosphere. Good food, interesting choices. Excellent ser
data.text: Excellent atmosphere. Old, high ceilings, good food, very interesting menu selections. Excellent service.

data.title: EXCELLENT SERVICE!
data.text: Amy was our server... She was WONDERFUL. She had recommendations from the menu. All of which was SUPERFANTASTIC.  We were just walking around Canton and sampling some of the area restaurants. We had the turtle soup(which was tasty), the salmon appetizer and the oysters on the half shell. We sat outside, such a wonderful evening in November(lol). I would recommend this place to anyone who wants a great taste of Canton. Remember to ask for Amy.....

data.title: Did Not Disappoint
data.text: Was a treat to have our annual event do their dinner at Benders.  While a bit expensive for northeast Ohio, the food did not disappoint.  We were with a large group which they handled very well.  I had a great Kurobata pork chop and my wife really enjoyed her entree of oysters.  The folks with us loved their steaks.  Benders deserves its excellent reputation.

data.title: Atmosphere and food
data.text: Downtown old style pup had a great atmosphere, a really good menu with lots of choices for a reasonable prices.  The food was really good.  It took a little longer than we wanted for lunch but not unreasonable long.  Not food related, but notice the front step when you go in, it is hollowed out from years and years of foot steps - that place has some history!

data.title: Great experience in a historic landmark
data.text: I met friends in Canton while we were there for a special event. We asked a police officer where was a good place to eat, and he recommended Bender's. It is an old tavern that once had separate entrances for men and women. There are multiple rooms, all looking old and regal. The food and the service were impeccable.

data.title: This place is awesome
data.text: Old (1902) bar/tavern/restaurant in downtown landmark. Tin ceilings, an awesome wood bar, stained glass, old murals. The history is staggering. You can easily see and feel yourself back in pre-Prohibition days sitting at the bar (without the spittoons, of course). Food is also great. Just makes for a good evening

data.title: Lunch
data.text: The food and the service were awesome. There was a varied menu. The temperature was delicious. It came quickly. The waiters checked on our table many times. We also met the 4th generation owner😊

data.title: Surprise of Canton
data.text: If you've been to Canton more than once, you already know about Benders.  Rather than spend your time at the franchises around the malls, this is the classic downtown, elbow rubbing, who's who, place to see & be seen.  And that's on top of a great menu.

data.title: Always get a good meal at Bender's Tavern
data.text: I thought I'd write a general review, as I've been going to this restaurant for the past several years. I've never had a bad meal here, whether lunch or dinner. Excellent food and the wait staff are very pleasant and courteous. It is a little higher priced but it is fine dining and very nice for a special occasion.

data.title: Our favorite place for date night
data.text: We love love love everything about Benders! Although we only ever ask for there best server Mary we have had others and all the staff is friendly and the owners are always on site to check to makes sure everything is awesome☺️ The food is fabulous and wine list incredible❤️

data.title: Business Dinner for group
data.text: My company reserved a space at Bender's Tavern for our annual executive dinner. This is Canton's oldest restaurant. The building is lovely and has so much history and character. The food was excellent!!! Some might assume that their filet is what they are known for. However, seafood is their specialty. Every other day, fresh seafood is delivered from Boston. Hallibut is what I ordered. Not only was it the best fish I have ever eaten, but it could easily feed two people. Also, the peanut butter sundae is so good. It is just the right size after a very filling meal. Service is top notch!! Thanks Jon and Jeanne for your consistent and patient communication throughout the event process.

data.title: Somewhere In Time
data.text: Had not been to Benders for so many years...forgot it was even there.  Had an out of town visitor, and decided to go downtown Canton.  What a treat.   Excellent food....wonderful service and fond memories from an old time establishment.

data.title: Bender's is an old style restaurant with class and great food.
data.text:
Bender's has a Gentlemen's pub attached to a fine restaurant. In fact several of the finest steaks I have ever eaten have been within the walls of this stately restaurant. 

I am a "Meat and potatoes" guy and my wife loves Salmon. I am not a wine drinker but the impressive wine list will please the snob in your group. It is in an old building. I find it lends to the charm. 

 I will quote one of the other reviewers. The first class old world charm and the history should make This restaurant a "Big Event Dinner go to choice" for people of this area. It is similar in ambiance to Charlie's 21 club in New York. Only I have never had as good a meal at Charlie's.

data.title: WONDERFUL!!!!
data.text:
Love this place!!!

Dress code is anywhere from dressed up to nice shorts and a collared shirt.

When you park in the lot, you don't think it's going to be as nice as it is. They have seating inside and on the porch. Watch the step as you walk in, it's over 100 years old and has been worn with age. THAT is part of Benders appeal!!!

When you walk into the doors, you see a bar and think, "is this it?" But NO!!! IT'S NOT!!! You walk to the back through an entry way and you walk into a wonderful old restaurant.

The wait staff are WONDERUL and educated about he food, drinks, and wine.
The food is AMAZING!!!!! Their steak is beyond reproach!!!!

You may be spending a little more for this meal, but it is DEFINITELY worth it!

data.title: Extended Family Reunion
data.text:
Whenever my aunt, uncle, and cousins visit, Saturday night we all get dressed up and go out for dinner to one of our favorite places. This time was Benders. Never ceases to delight us. 
It isn't inexpensive, so realize that going in, but this is a classic Canton institution, and a must visit.

data.title: Birthday dinner
data.text:
Have eaten in Benders many many times, has always been first class

old world charm, old building, with some history

however, my Brother was visiting from out of town and i thought i would take him for a special evening

the waiter was clueless spend more time talking to the table next door

we both had steak and they both came out wrong, I asked for medium and it was incinerated, my brother asked for well done and it was raw

the waiter said he would handle, our new steaks showed up 15 minutes later and all of the accompanyments were cold

Paid way too much money for poor service and poor food

will not go back after this experience

data.title: Just OK
data.text:
Old school place - my wife said that her Dad would bring business guests here back in the 60's & 70's.  He would not think things had changed at all. 

An extensive wine list was presented to me as the man at the table.  Limited selection of wines by the glass, but a lot was available if we wanted to get a whole bottle.

The chicken and walleye we ordered was very good.  The Bender Fries were thick with grease and the green beans were fresh, but nothing special.

Again, just OK - nothing special.

data.title: Best fine dining experience
data.text:
If you are looking for a fine dining experience with excellent service and selections of sea food this is the best place we have found in the area so far.

Not a lot of atmosphere. 

It is an old restaurant, In an old place, With a very much older crowd.  But you will not be disappointed with your server or your meal!
